thread.section_title: Palm Beach County High School Sports - Sun Sentinel
thread.title: Wellington holds off late Seminole Ridge push
thread.title_full: Wellington holds off late Seminole Ridge push - Sun Sentinel

author: Y.A. Teitelbaum
title: Wellington holds off late Seminole Ridge push
text:
Wellington scored early and often, but had to hold off Seminole Ridge for a 24-21 win in a District 9-8A game Friday night.
Senior quarterback Blake Dever showed off his arm with two touchdowns for Wellington in the first quarter, including a 67-yarder to four-star receiver Ahmmon Richards on the game's first play. Richards, a University of Miami commit, finished with four catches for 139 yards to lead Wellington, which improved to 2-0 in district play and 4-2 overall.
Seminole Ridge (0-2, 1-4) cut the margin to 24-21 on Brown's 45-yard TD pass to Ty Smith with 25.1 seconds remaining. But Mark Lopez recovered the onsides kick to secure the win for Wellington.
The Wolverines scored 10 points on consecutive possessions in the fourth quarter to snap a 14-14 tie. Logan Robinson converted a 28-yard field goal to give the Wolverines a 17-14 advantage. Then freshman Mark Anthony Richards scored on a four-yard run up the middle to give Wellington a 24-14 edge with 6:02 left.
Alex Brosseau intercepted Brown on the Hawks next possession.
Wellington started quickly, scored twice on their first five plays to take a 14-0 lead.
On Wellington's second possession, Dever hit Kevin Wright down the middle for a 52-yard TD pass on a third-and-18 play.
Complete coverage package: Palm Beach high school football, week 6 Read more stories The Hawks cut the margin to 14-7 when sophomore quarterback hit Ty Smith on a 25-yard TD pass in the left corner of the end zone with 33.6 seconds remaining in the first half.
Seminole Ridge had a touchdown run by Brown nullified on a holding call with two minutes remaining in the second quarter. On fourth-and-goal from the eight, Brown's pass was knocked down by Austin Gilman in the end zone.
